channel.title: Microsoft Learn - in Intune
channel.description: The latest updates from Microsoft Learn in Intune

item.title: Restrict devices features using policy in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add a device configuration profile to restrict features on Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, AOSP, macOS, iOS, iPadOS, and Windows 10/11 client devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Device features and settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Overview of the different Microsoft Intune device profiles. Get info on GPO, features, restrictions, email, wifi, VPN, education, certificates, upgrade Windows 10/11, BitLocker and Microsoft Defender, and custom device configuration settings in the Microsoft Intune admin center. Use these profiles to manage and protect data and devices in your company.

item.title: eSIM configuration of a download server - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about configuration of an eSIM Download Server from Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Enable eSIM data connections in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or use eSIM to get internet and data access using different data plans. In Intune, add or import activation codes, and then assign these activation codes using a configuration profile. You can also monitor the eSIM profiles and check the status of the eSIM-enabled devices.

item.title: In development - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes Microsoft Intune features that are in development.

item.title: Using Remote Help on Windows to assist authenticated users. - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Remote Help app to provide remote assistance to authenticated users who also run the Remote Help app, and to troubleshoot for frontline workers (FLW).

item.title: Using Azure Virtual Desktop single-session with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidelines for using Azure Virtual Desktop single-session with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add, Configure, and Protect Apps with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add, configure, and protect apps with Intune.

item.title: Deployment guide for Windows device management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use our platform deployment guide to set up Windows device management in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Performance recommendations when using filters - Microsoft Intune
item.description: When using filters in Microsoft Intune, use Intune virtual groups that don't require Microsoft Entra ID syncing. To improve performance, reuse groups, make incremental group changes, and use filters to include and exclude.

item.title: Intune operated by 21Vianet in China - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Intune operated by 21Vianet in China.

item.title: UI updates for Intune end-user apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Find out what has changed in UI for apps that work on end-user devices with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use Remediations to Detect and Fix Support Issues - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about Remediations in Microsoft Intune, including what Remediations are and view any prerequisites and licensing requirements. Also, learn how to deploy built-in and custom remediation scripts, and learn how to monitor your scripts.

item.title: Use Windows cloud configuration in a guided scenario - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use a guided scenario to configure Windows 10/11 client devices in a cloud configuration in Microsoft Intune. Cloud config focuses on a simplified device experience for internet browsing and using Microsoft 365 apps, including Microsoft Teams.

item.title: What's new in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Find out what's new in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Filter reports and troubleshooting in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the device and app filter reports to get more information on successfully applied filters. Learn the effect of include and exclude filters in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Microsoft Intune Reports - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Intune provides specific report types with focused views that contain consistent and timely data.

item.title: Create filters in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about policy assignment filters, and see the steps to create, update, or delete a filter in Microsoft Intune. Create an assignment filter for managed devices or managed apps scenarios.

item.title: Windows device enrollment guide for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enroll Windows devices using Automatic enrollment, Windows Autopilot, group policy, and co-management enrollment options in Microsoft Intune. Decide which enrollment method to use, and get an overview of the administrator and end user tasks to enroll devices.

item.title: Intune Graph API - Reports and Properties - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Intune reports and properties provided via Graph API.

item.title: Using Azure Virtual Desktop multi-session with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidelines for using Azure Virtual Desktop multi-session with Microsoft Intune

item.title: Create a custom role in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to create a custom role in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Overview of the Microsoft Intune MDM lifecycle - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how Intune helps you manage devices through their lifecycle - from enrollment, through configuration, to eventual retirement.

item.title: Policy Sets - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use policy sets to group collections of management objects in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Guided Scenario - Cloud-Managed Modern Desktop - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the guided scenario to set up and configure a basic Modern Desktop from the Microsoft 365 Device Management portal.

item.title: Configure schedules to gradually roll out Windows Updates in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure schedules that manage how and when Windows updates roll out to your managed devices with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Learn about Intune security baselines for Windows devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Deploy security baselines that have preset and recommended configurations to the Windows devices you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure device configuration profiles in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or configure a device configuration profile in Microsoft Intune. Select the platform type, configure the settings, and add a scope tag. Learn more about applicability rules, and the policy refresh cycle times.

item.title: Intune endpoint security firewall settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Endpoint security firewall policy settings for Windows and macOS in Microsoft Intune

item.title: How to Use Microsoft Entra ID to Access Intune APIs in Microsoft Graph - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Describes steps needed for apps to use Microsoft Entra ID to access the Intune APIs in Microsoft Graph.

item.title: Intune endpoint security Account protection (Preview) policy settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Endpoint security Account protection policy settings in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Intune endpoint security Attack surface reduction settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Details about the settings in the endpoint security Attack surface reduction policies in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Settings you can manage with Intune Endpoint Protection profiles for Windows devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the available settings in Intune endpoint protection profiles for managed Windows devices.

item.title: Windows Update settings you can manage with Intune Update Ring policies for Windows devices. - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the settings for Windows Update that you can manage through Intune policy for Update rings.

item.title: Settings list for the Microsoft Intune security baseline for Microsoft Defender for Endpoint - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the settings in the Microsoft Intune security baseline for Microsoft Defender for Endpoint and each settings default value.

item.title: List of settings for the Microsoft HoloLens 2 advanced security baseline in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View a list of the settings in the Microsoft Intune advanced security baseline for Microsoft HoloLens 2. This list includes the default values for settings as found in the default configuration of the baseline.

item.title: List of settings for the Microsoft Edge security baseline in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View a list of the settings in the Microsoft Intune security baseline version 112 and later, for the Microsoft Edge browser. This list includes the default values for settings as found in the default configuration of the baseline.

item.title: List of settings for the Microsoft 365 Apps for Enterprise security baseline in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View a list of the settings in the Microsoft Intune security baseline for Microsoft Office apps. This list includes the default values for settings as found in the default configuration of the baseline.

item.title: Settings list for the Microsoft Edge security baseline in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View a list of the settings in the Microsoft Intune security baseline for Microsoft Edge browser. This list includes the default values for settings as found in the default configuration of the baseline.

item.title: List of settings for the Microsoft HoloLens 2 standard security baseline in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View a list of the settings in the Microsoft Intune standard security baseline for Microsoft HoloLens 2. This list includes the default values for settings as found in the default configuration of the baseline.

item.title: Settings list for the Windows 365 Cloud PC security baseline in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View a list of the settings in the Microsoft Intune security baseline for Windows 365 Cloud PC. This list includes the default values for settings as found in the default configuration of the baseline.

item.title: Default configuration of Intune's Windows security baselines - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the default setting configuration of the various Microsoft Intune security baselines for Windows.

item.title: Windows compliance settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See a list of all the settings you can use when setting compliance for your Windows, Windows Holographic, and Surface Hub devices in Microsoft Intune. Check for compliance on the minimum and maximum operating system, set password restrictions and length, check for partner anti-virus (AV) solutions, enable encryption on data storage, and more.

item.title: iOS/iPadOS device compliance settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the device compliance settings for iOS/iPadOS that you can manage with Microsoft Intune compliance policies.

item.title: Windows Antivirus policy settings for Microsoft Defender Antivirus for Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See a list of the settings in the Microsoft Defender Antivirus profile for Windows devices. You can configure these settings as part of Endpoint security Antivirus policy in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Get Started With the Microsoft Intune App SDK - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Quickly enable your mobile app for mobile application management (MAM) with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: View the Android device administrator compliance settings for Microsoft Intune compliance policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the device compliance settings that are available for Android device administrator devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Android (AOSP) compliance settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the device compliance settings for Android (AOSP) that you can manage with Microsoft Intune compliance policies.

item.title: Intune endpoint security firewall settings for Configuration Manager devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Endpoint security firewall policy settings for tenant attached devices you manage with Configuration Manager. You can configure firewall setting after you configure tenant attach for Configuration Manager.

item.title: Antivirus policy settings for Windows Security experience policy for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Endpoint security Antivirus policy settings for the Windows Security app in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Windows Antivirus policy settings from Windows security settings for tenant attached devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Review the settings in the *Windows Security experience* profile for tenant attached devices. To use this Endpoint security Antivirus policy, you must first configure tenant attach for Configuration Manager for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Windows 8.1 compliance settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the device compliance settings for Windows 8.1 that you can manage with Microsoft Intune compliance policies.

item.title: Android Enterprise compliance settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See a list of all the settings you can use when setting compliance for your Android Enterprise devices in Microsoft Intune. Set password rules, choose a minimum or maximum operating system version, restrict specific apps, prevent reusing password, and more.

item.title: Use Microsoft Tunnel VPN with iOS/iPad devices that don't enroll with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add support for Mobile Application Management (MAM) for iOS to the Microsoft Tunnel Gateway. Tunnel support for MAM expands access to your organizational resources for devices that can't or haven't enrolled with Microsoft Intune. Admins should use this article to create policies that support per-app VPN in line of business (LOB) apps.

item.title: Use a PKCS certificate profile to provision devices with certificates in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Public Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS) certificates with Microsoft Intune, work with root certificates and certificate templates, and use device configuration profiles for a PKCS Certificate.

item.title: Manage antivirus settings with endpoint security policies in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure and deploy policies and use reports for devices you manage with endpoint security antivirus policy in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Windows Hello for Business settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View details for Windows Hello for Business settings you configure in an Intune identity protection profile for device groups in Intune.

item.title: Prerequisites the Microsoft Tunnel VPN for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Review the prerequisites for installation and use of the Microsoft Tunnel Gateway. These include Linux servers, network, and firewall configurations.

item.title: Windows Antivirus policy settings from Microsoft Defender Antivirus for tenant attached devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See a list of the settings in the Microsoft Defender Antivirus profile for Windows devices managed by Configuration Manager. You can configure these settings as part of Endpoint security Antivirus policy in Microsoft Intune after you configure tenant attach for Configuration Manager.

item.title: Add and assign MTD apps to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Intune to add Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) apps, Microsoft Authenticator app, and iOS configuration policy in Microsoft Intune

item.title: macOS device compliance settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the device compliance settings for macOS devices that you can manage with Microsoft Intune compliance policies.

item.title: Android App Protection Policy Settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the app protection policy settings for Android devices.

item.title: App Protection Policies Overview - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how Microsoft Intune app protection policies help protect your company data and prevent data loss.

item.title: iOS/iPadOS App Protection Policy Settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the iOS/iPadOS app protection policy (APP) settings for iOS/iPadOS devices.

item.title: Understand Microsoft Intune Management Extension - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand Microsoft Intune management extension for Windows.

item.title: Manage Apple Volume-Purchased Apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to sync apps you bought in volume through Apple Business Manager with Microsoft Intune. Then manage and track these apps on iOS/iPadOS and macOS devices.

item.title: Add Win32 App Supersedence - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Win32 app supersedence with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manually Add the Windows 10 Company Portal App - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how your workforce can manually add the Windows 10 Company Portal app to their PC from the Microsoft Store.

item.title: PowerShell Scripts for Remediations - Microsoft Intune
item.description: PowerShell script reference for Remediations.

item.title: Add Web Apps to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about adding web apps (client-server applications) to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: High-Level Architecture for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This reference architecture shows options for integrating Microsoft Intune in your Azure environment with Microsoft Entra ID.

item.title: Data Protection for Windows MAM - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable protected MAM access to org data using Windows MAM.

item.title: Add and Assign an App - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this article, you'll use Microsoft Intune to add and assign an app.

item.title: Use Graph APIs to Export Intune Reports - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about exporting Intune reports using Graph APIs.

item.title: Send Notifications to Noncompliant Devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this topic, you use Microsoft Intune to send email notifications to noncompliant devices.

item.title: Get App Bundle ID - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Get the app bundle ID in Microsoft Intune for Android, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, and Windows apps. Use the bundle ID in your app policies, device configuration profiles, enrollment policies, and compliance policies in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Help Desk Troubleshooting Dashboard - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Help desk staff use the troubleshooting pane to solve users' technical problems.

item.title: Review App Protection Policy Logs - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This topic describes how to configure Intune app protection policy (APP) logs.

item.description: Step 4. Create app configuration policy for Microsoft Edge for Business.

item.title: Data Warehouse Data Model - Microsoft Intune
item.description: The Microsoft Intune Data Warehouse samples data daily to provide a historical view of your continually changing mobile environment.

item.title: Intune Data Warehouse API Endpoint - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This reference topic describes the Microsoft Intune Data Warehouse API URL structure. Filter examples are provided.

item.title: Create and Assign an App Protection Policy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this article, you use Microsoft Intune to create and assign and app protection policy.

item.title: Step 2. Create App Protection Policies for Microsoft Edge for Business - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 2. Create app protection policies for Microsoft Edge for Business.

item.title: Guided Scenario - Deploy Microsoft Edge for Mobile - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the guided scenario to deploy Microsoft Edge for Mobile from the Microsoft 365 Device Management portal.

item.title: Guided Scenarios Overview - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the Intune guided scenarios available in the Microsoft 365 Device Management portal.

item.title: Guided Scenario - Secure Microsoft Office Mobile Apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the guided scenario to deploy secure Microsoft Office mobile apps from the Microsoft 365 Device Management portal.

item.title: Step 5. Understand Microsoft Edge for Business End User Experience for Windows - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 5. Understand Microsoft Edge for Business end user experience Windows.

item.title: Manage Volume-Purchased Apps and Books with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about how you can use Microsoft Intune to manage and monitor your use of volume-purchased apps and books from stores."

item.title: Step 6. Troubleshoot Microsoft Edge for Business Data Security - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 6. Troubleshoot Microsoft Edge for Business corporate data security in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Validate Your App Protection Policy Setup - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to test that your app protection policy is set up and working correctly in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Tutorial - Configure Slack to Use Intune for EMM and App Configuration - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this tutorial you will configure Slack to use Intune for EMM and app configuration.

item.title: Manage Volume-Purchased iOS/iPadOS eBooks - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to sync books you purchased in volume from the iOS store with Intune. You can then manage and track usage.

item.title: Create a Group to Manage Users - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this article, you'll use Microsoft Intune to create a group based on existing users.

item.title: Password Compliance Policy for Android Enterprise Devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this topic, you will use Microsoft Intune to set the length of the password required for Android Enterprise devices.

item.title: Try Microsoft Intune Overview - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Evaluate Microsoft Intune by stepping through common Intune settings.

item.title: Block Apps with No Modern Authentication on Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about applications and modern authentication (MSAL) using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Tutorial - Walkthrough the Microsoft Intune Admin Center - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this tutorial, you will tour Microsoft Intune in the Microsoft Intune admin center to better understand how to accomplish tasks.

item.title: Manage Transferring Data Between iOS Apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand how to use mobile app management policies in Microsoft Intune to manage data transfers between apps.

item.title: Supported Microsoft Intune Apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article provides lists of support partner and Microsoft apps that are commonly used with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Intune Data Warehouse Change Log - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This topic provides a list of changes for the Microsoft Intune Data Warehouse API.
